sentences.english: Think about if you get bitten by a snake.
sentences.chinese: 想想如果你被一條蛇咬傷。

sentences.english: We want to know the progress of treating toxic wound caused by cobra.
sentences.chinese: 我們想知道眼鏡王蛇咬傷中毒的治療進展。

sentences.english: The 15-pound animal bit three people after escaping from its owner's home.
sentences.chinese: 這個15磅重的傢伙從主人家裏逃出來後咬傷三人。

sentences.english: Objective Discuss misdiagnosis mistreatment after poisonous spider bite.
sentences.chinese: 目的討論毒蜘蛛咬傷後的誤診誤治。

sentences.english: Objective To evaluate the effect of hemoperfusion in the critically-type neurotoxie poisonous snake bites.
sentences.chinese: 目的探討血液灌流法對重危型神經毒毒蛇咬傷的療效。

sentences.english: I in Thailand when they accidentally bites.
sentences.chinese: 本人在泰國的時候就不小心被狗咬傷。

sentences.english: Snakebite usually have no more than Yayin.
sentences.chinese: 無毒蛇咬傷通常有多個牙印。

sentences.english: The project also wants communities to learn about snakebites and first aid.
sentences.chinese: 這個項目組也想讓社會了解蛇咬傷和急救護理。

sentences.english: The bite of a mad dog is fatal.
It is often used as folk medicine to cure snake bites.
sentences.chinese: 它常被用作民間藥物治療蛇咬傷。

sentences.english: Renal injury is one of the severe and common complications in snakebite.
sentences.chinese: 腎損傷是蛇咬傷常見的嚴重併發症之一。

sentences.english: Do you have any antidote for a snakebite?
sentences.chinese: 你有治療毒蛇咬傷的解毒藥嗎？

sentences.english: Brown recluse spider bites can often look like the common bull's-eye.
sentences.chinese: 棕色隱士蜘蛛咬傷通常可以像常見的靶心。

sentences.english: The dog struck at my leg.
They can bite much more effective then even German ship (police) dogs.
sentences.chinese: 它們的咬傷力也比德國警犬強。

sentences.english: Objective To explore ways and means of preventing and treating renal functional lesion caused by agkistrodon bite.
sentences.chinese: 目的探討腹蛇咬傷致腎功能損害的預防和治療方法。

definition: to hunt and kill (an animal or fish)
to meet violent death/to get killed
lit. to punch and kick (idiom); to beat up/fig. determined to sort out a problem
to fiddle with/to tamper with/to meddle with/to move randomly/to flail about
to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)
a burn (tissue damage from heat, chemicals etc)/to burn (the skin etc)/(fig.) (of anger, jealousy etc) to hurt (sb)
to cry piteously/anguished wailing/same as 哀嚎
to die in such a way that sb (or sth) else also perishes/to take sb down with oneself/to end in mutual destruction
